result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:35 AM Defendant Courtney C Rice appeared by video in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Courtney C Rice.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF389, 22CF160
Atty Erdman - asks bonds be converted to signature bonds. 
State - objects to signature bonds. Bonds are reasonable. Speaks of several missed court appearances. 
Atty Erdman - argues
Court - denies request to modify bonds in 21CF389, 22CF160.
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:49 AM Defendant Courtney C Rice in court in custody from DCJ.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Courtney C Rice.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF389, (22CF160 - BR 1 case)
State - Has same witness for both cases. Calls Deputy Adam Zukowski. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness identifies defendant. Asks court to take judicial notice of bond in Dunn County case 21CF389.
Court - judicial notice taken
Atty Erdman - cross examines witness
10:55 AM witness is excused
parties have no further witnesses or evident.
State - ask court to find both cases are trans actually related. Find probable cause and bind over.
Atty Erdman - argues there is no probable cause in 22CF160.  State - argues
Court - finds probable cause and binds over. Sets ARGN in both cases in Br 3. Schedules bond review hearing at request of Atty Erdman.
Arraignment scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
